titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of letters from a father to his son, Bo and Jackie, respectively. Bo seems to have lived in Pasadena, California, and Jackie may have lived in the Philadelphia area, but also appears to have traveled extensively. Both appear to have been artists; Bo offered his golf drawings for sale to Harper's [Magazine?] and other publications, and Jackie was a painter, whose works may have been for sale at Stendhal Galleries in Los Angeles, among other outlets. The letters are nearly daily, and discuss the art work of both men, the lives and health of family and friends, woodworking projects (many apparently for painting accessories, such as palettes and easels), cars, and the weather. In many letters, Bo offered advice to Jackie on the subjects, execution, and sale of his artwork.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
